title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.6: VAN - CCA-DRR

description.narrative: Output 2.6 By 2017, communities and government have the capacity in preparing and responding to disasters and adapting to climate change in Vanuatu, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: H&S Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Children and families benefit from equitable and sustainable access to safe drinking water, improved sanitation and hygiene within communities that are increasingly resilient to the impact of climate change and natural disasters.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.6 By 2017, communities and government have the capacity in preparing and responding to disasters and adapting to climatechange in Vanuatu

description.narrative: Strengthened government coordination has increased sector efficiency to respond to emergencies. Building on lessons from Tropical Cyclone Pam, 5,051 people and 61 schools were supported on Ambae and Santo Islands and benefited from UNICEF support for Ambae Island repatriation in partnership with the Department of Water Resources and World Vision. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/11/2017

title.narrative: Functional WASH Coordination mechanism in place
WASH sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of cluster coordination mechanism for WASH

actual.value: 2017:Yes. Water Policy and the National Drinking Water Safety and Security Planning guidelines which put climate resilient and risk management at the core.
